parameters.definition: Number of people a motorcycle can transport per shift
Pollution units produced by one motorcycle per shift
Earnings from one motorcycle per shift
Number of people a sedan can transport per shift
Pollution units produced by one sedan per shift
Earnings from one sedan per shift
Maximum proportion of motorcycles in the vehicle fleet
Maximum pollution units the company can produce per shift
Minimum number of people the company needs to transport per shift

description: A taxi company will purchase vehicles to rent to their drivers. They are interested in purchasing either motorcycles or sedans. A motorcycle can transport \param{MotorcycleCapacity} people, produces \param{MotorcyclePollution} units of pollution, and earns the taxi company \param{MotorcycleEarnings} per shift. A sedan can transport \param{SedanCapacity} people, produces \param{SedanPollution} units of pollution, and earns the company \param{SedanEarnings} per shift. Because not every customer is comfortable with a motorcycle, at most \param{MaxMotorcycleProportion} of vehicles can be motorcycles. Additionally, the company has committed to producing less than \param{MaxPollution} units of pollution. The company needs to transport at least \param{MinPeopleTransported} people every shift. How many of each type of vehicle should be used to maximize the total earnings for the taxi company per shift?
